title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Monday 4 December 2017 - BBC News
summary: mental health care for new mums questioned .
plans for new royal clarence hotel considered .
tractor rescues stranded car from newquay beach .

documents.title: row over officer 's ambulance wait tweet
text: row over officer 's ambulance wait tweet

documents.title: royal clarence rebuild unanimously approved
text: rebuilding plans for the royal clarence hotel in exeter have been unanimously approved by city planners .
the hotel , which is reputed to be the oldest in england , was destroyed by fire in october 2016 .
the owner , andrew brownsword , says the plans will retain the frontage of the grade 2 listed building , which faces onto cathedral green .
they will also redesign the inside of the hotel and allow the adjoining well house pub , which was also badly damaged , to be rebuilt .
exeter city council planning officers recommended approval calling them a `` welcome response '' to the fire .
architect martin kirkpatrick told the meeting `` the facade will be true to the original '' and 98 % of people at a public consultation event made positive comments .
he said councillors approved the plans with a number of conditions after concerns were raised the roof would be higher resulting in light pollution or loss of views .
author: Hamish Marshall
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: live updates for devon and cornwall have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 08:00 on tuesday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .

documents.title: weather : few light showers , but some sunny spells
text: it will be largely cloudy tonight with light winds for most , and with a chance of a few light showers in the west and across the higher ground of dartmoor and bodmin moor .
where the cloud does break , it will become cold with the risk of some patchy fog .
minimum temperature : 3c ( 37f ) .
it will be a bright day with often large amounts of cloud , but also with a few sunny spells .
there will be a few light showers through the day , these mainly in the west , with many places in the east staying largely dry .
maximum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: matavesi happy to balance career with rugby
text: matavesi happy to balance career with rugby
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: £ 30,000 tractor stolen in bovey tracey
text: a tractor worth £ 30,000 has been stolen from a farm in bovey tracey , police have said .
the red mccormick agricultural tractor was taken overnight between thursday , 30 november , and friday , 1 december .
police are appealing for information .
author: Sarah Gosling
BBC News Online

documents.title: plymouth railway murder : man jailed for life
text: a man who stabbed another man to death on a train station concourse has been jailed for life .
wayne fenton , 49 , died in hospital following a stabbing attack at plymouth railway station on 8 august .
jamie skinner , 29 , of bodmin road , plymouth , pleaded guilty to murder at plymouth crown court .
mr kenton suffered `` 40 knife injuries '' in total , the court heard .
skinner will serve a minimum of 22 years and six months .
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: top twitter cop in row again - this time over ambulance delay question
text: he 's been in hot water before over his tweets and now sgt harry tangye has done it again with a tweet questioning the time ambulances take on 999 calls .
the armed response officer 's post came as south western ambulance service nhs foundation trust ( swasft ) said it was experiencing `` electrical failure '' .
it said : `` sgt harry tangye obviously had n't heard we had a problem yesterday with our power supply . ''
mr tangye , winner of the police twitter awards in 2016 , was unavailable for immediate comment .
in august he sparked controversy after a tweet about drug addicts in which he said he was
he later took down the tweet , saying : `` it 's too big a subject for 140 characters . ''
he also came under fire online for tweeting a video of a police car driving at 140mph to a break in .
some people said the video should never have been tweeted but others said that police officers are highly trained and should not be told how to do their jobs .
cops out there are you finding waits for ambulances are taking forever now or even never ?
i had a paramedic ( car ) wait 6 hours with me , for an ambulance to come and take me to hospital .
he received multiple calls whilst waiting but could n't leave me .
it was as bad for me as it was him , as i felt like others needed his help more than i did .
thank you for this sue .
sounds like a nightmare .
these crews are heros going from job to job .
just seems to be not enough of them about along with ambulances being called out for inappropriate calls .
our area is shocking , as the local gps have merged and they ca n't meet the demand .
people call 111 and they send an ambulance .
the drain on resources is shocking .
as a former nhs employee , i 've seen both sides of it now .
it ca n't go on though .
it 's dangerous .
fascinating stuff .
thanks sue
harry .
do n't think this is very helpful or productive towards us as police officers or towards or ambulance colleagues .
do n't see why .
our ambulance colleagues are in full agreement .
overworked with little rest .
i will open observations for discussion which are effecting us all so greatly .
certainly no criticism for the overstretched staff .
just think your staying the obvious !
does it really need to open that subject ?
everyone in the emergency services & the public know we 're over stretched , under funded & under resourced.chief officers , politicians , federations & unions are challenging it daily .
most definitely we should
falls into the # captainobvious bracket ! !
every professional public service body has tried & failed to change the governments mind over cuts in the last 7yrs .
not sure what u though your twitter pole was going 2 achieve .
we all knew what the result and comments were going to be !
yes .
longer delays .
partly down to us as police requesting them when really we should be able to tell the injured party to make their own way to gp , 111 or a+e
totally get that .
we see the adverts asking public to only use for emergencies and i hear officers calling to just check .
# litigation issues but can be got round .
if at all possible get the person who needs to be checked out to call 999 themselves .
they 'll be triaged through normal system , they 'll be given an eta or a non ambulance disposition , taking responsibility away from a officers and any risk of litigation .
ah , i 've been there .
police feel obliged to wait for ambulance in case things get worse .
that sounds interesting though .
harry , is it a legal or moral obligation ?
86 % drop in ambulance waiting time issues .
average response time of 5 minutes .
some of the data from our teams in london who work jointly with @ twitterid every weekend !
feel free to join us for an observer shift !
sounds like a cracking idea .
and seems to be working really well for you .
more rural forces may be an issue with so much travelling time meaning more required .
thanks for the info though
we tried this in wiltshire .
it works in areas like swindon but a challenge elsewhere .
perfect thank you scott .
1/2 yes .

but i also hear cops contributing to the problem by asking for ambulances when they 're not required , and getting police control to recontsct ambulance control to chase-up attendance at non-urgent jobs .
2/2 i 'd be genuinely interested to know what the answer would be if you added for genuine life-threatening emergencies '' on the end .
you make a good point .
i think fear of litigation is probably causing huge delays .
i know police who call ambulance for very minor injuries as they 'd be hung out to dry if the patient did go downhill .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: library offers christmas day cheer with mince pies !
text: plymouth 's central library is opening on christmas day for people who would like some company .
there will be free mince pies , tea and coffee , along with a festive film show and library computers for anyone who wants to keep in touch with family or friends .
`` we know there are lots of people who may not have somewhere to go at christmas , '' said councillor glenn jordan , cabinet member for culture .
`` by opening the library on christmas day we are offering those who will be alone a safe and welcoming place to visit . ''
the library on armada way will be open from 13:30 until 16:00 on christmas day .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: a very un-festive theft in st austell
text: a 3ft ( 91cm ) light up father christmas and three decorative presents are among items reported stolen from a house in st austell .
police are appealing for witnesses after the items were cut from their cables in a garden on slades road in the early hours of sunday , 3 december .
author: Sarah Gosling
BBC News Online

documents.title: cornish pirates sign forward matavesi
text: cornish pirates sign forward matavesi

documents.title: lorry crashes through barriers and lamp post and into wall
text: a lorry has smashed into a wall in plymouth this afternoon , causing delays for motorists in the area .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: 'tough choices ' ahead of budget plans
text: changes to lifeguard cover , public toilets and parking charges are being considered as south hams district council prepares to set its budget for the next financial year .
it says `` tough choices '' and `` difficult decisions '' will have to be made if the budget is going to balance , with a £ 4m reduction in grants from central government over the past 10 years .
councillor simon wright , deputy leader of the council , said it now has to look closely at non-statutory services , which may include increasing charges and cutting services .
`` we consider cutting services the last resort and is not something we consider lightly , but we are running out of alternative options , '' he said .
final decisions on next year 's budget will be made at a meeting of the full council in february .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: devon travel update : car in ditch
text: on the a377 between lapford cross and nymet bridge a car has left the road and is in a ditch - drivers should approach the area with care .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: radiotherapy could move from cornwall to plymouth
text: cancer patients requiring radiotherapy treatment might have to go to derriford in plymouth as part of a move by nhs england to centralise services .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: expenses complaint 'politically motivated ' mp says
text: plymouth mp johnny mercer says he 's confident an investigation into his expenses will be dismissed .

expenses claims by the conservative member for plymouth moor view are being investigated by the compliance officer for the independent parliamentary standards authority ( ipsa ) , which was set up in 2010 after the expenses scandal .
mr mercer said in a statement : `` i am happy to comply with yet another investigation as a result of yet another politically motivated complaint against my office .
`` as with the previous complaints , i am confident this one will be dismissed as well and i can say now that i am unaware of any wrongdoing .
`` both i and my office are working with ipsa to speed up this process and to bring this to a swift and satisfactory conclusion . ''
author: Martyn Oates
BBC South West Political Editor

documents.title: boss hints stores like plymouth 'first to close '
text: the boss of toy retailer toys r us has suggested that stores like plymouth 's western way outlet will be among the first to shut down .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: floating car sparks major 999 rescue
text: coastguards , police , a lifeboat and fire engines were all called out after a report of a car in a cornish creek - only for them to discover it was an amphibious vehicle .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: devon travel update : crash near great torrington
text: there are reports of a collision between great torrington and beaford on the a3124 between the a386 and green lane .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: cornwall travel update
text: slow-moving traffic on the a30 eastbound at launceston , as a result of an accident just before the hicks mill turn-off .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: weather for devon and cornwall
text: this afternoon will see a mix of sunny spells and cloudier intervals .
it should remain dry for most , although a few light showers are possible across the west .
light winds , with a maximum temperature of 11c ( 52 f ) .
under any clear skies this evening some fog patches may form and temperatures will fall close to freezing , with a minimum temperature of 3c ( 37f )
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: dog stuck up tree after chasing squirrel
text: a dog has been rescued from a tree after chasing a squirrel .
firefighters were called to wolborough street , newton abbot , after the animal was `` too frightened to come down '' .
devon and somerset fire and rescue service said the dog was stuck about 20ft ( 6m ) up the tree that was at a 30 degree angle .
fire crews used a triple extension ladder to rescue the terrier earlier today .

documents.title: mp investigated by expenses watchdog
text: expenses claims made by johnny mercer , the conservative mp for plymouth moor view , are being investigated , the bbc can reveal .
the investigation by the compliance officer for the independent parliamentary standards authority involves `` office costs in respect of website use and other 'e-presence ' '' .
this is the first investigation by the compliance officer for nearly two years .
the independent parliamentary standards authority was set up to regulate mps ' business costs and expenses in may 2010 , following the parliamentary expenses scandal of the previous year .
mr mercer has been approached by the bbc but has n't yet responded .
author: Martyn Oates
BBC South West Political Editor

documents.title: more traveller sites for plymouth confirmed
text: council chiefs have signed off plans for more traveller sites to be created in plymouth in an effort to stop them hogging parcel of council land .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: ambulance staff use mobiles after phones fail
text: south western ambulance service says it is in a `` recovery phase '' after a major electrical failure led to `` significant issues '' with its phone and computer systems on sunday evening .
staff told the bbc they had resorted to using their mobile phones to co-ordinate ambulances following the failure at its 999 call centre .
the phone lines are now back up but the service said it was still experiencing some it problems .
a statement said : `` we are able to provide a seamless service to out patients and are no longer having to rely on mutual aid from our neighbouring ambulance services .
`` we have launched a full investigation into the cause of the electrical failure and will be reviewing our processes and procedures in light of this event . ''
swasft
swasft

full statement attached .
we would ask the public to continue to # choosewell and only dial 999 in an emergency .

documents.title: silver medal for cornish surfer
text: huge shout-out to cornwall 's charlotte banfield who won a silver medal in california at the weekend in the as1 catagory @ isasurfing @ twitterid @ twitterid # adaptivesurfing # isaworlds
well done charlotte !
charlotte ! ! !
simply amazing - well done ! ! !

documents.title: deer killed and van written off in collision on a380 telegraph hill
text: a 19-year-old van driver has been taken to hospital and his van written off in a collision with a deer on the a380 near telegraph hill .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: authority asked to provide free fishing safety equipment
text: torbay council is being urged to buy personal locator devices and life jackets for fishermen who ca n't afford them .
the fishing industry has one of the highest accident and death rates in the uk , and last month plymouth city council announced it had successfully applied for funding to buy safety equipment .
now two councillors in torbay have asked their authority to consider a similar scheme and the idea will be discussed later this week .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: tractor rescues stranded car from newquay beach
text: a farmer used his tractor to pull an elderly couple 's car to safety after it got stuck on a cornish beach .
newquay coastguard said the driver had gone on to newquay 's great western beach to turn around when the car became stranded in the soft sand on saturday .
the coastguard team said the car 's elderly passengers , who were cold and had medical conditions , were taken to a nearby hotel .
the driver was put in touch with a local farmer and by the time he arrived , the tide was lapping at the wheels of the car .
`` we remind people again , please do not drive on to beaches unless you are in a suitable vehicle and know it is safe , '' newquay coastguard said .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: heroin and crack cocaine seized in totnes
text: police have seized more than 20 wraps of what is believed to be heroin and crack cocaine in totnes .
the drugs were found on a man at 16:45 on sunday , said officers .
a man has been arrested on sus of drugs offences .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: 'recovery phase ' for ambulance service after system failure
text: the south western ambulance service says it 's still in a `` recovery phase '' after an electrical fault caused a massive failure to its phone system .
the problems with the phones and computers forced the service to revert to a backup system .
on sunday , it issued a statement asking people to only call 999 in a life threatening emergency .
today it says it 's able to provide a `` seamless '' service to patients , but as there are still outstanding it issues , it 's reminding the public to only dial 999 in an emergency .
yesterday 's ( sunday , december 3 ) electrical failure that affected some of our systems has now been largely resolved .
full statement attached .
we would ask the public to continue to # choosewell and only dial 999 in an emergency .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'serial arsonist ' appeal prompts public response
text: police say they have had a few responses to an appeal for help in trying to catch an arsonist who they believe has deliberately started 14 fires in exeter .
on friday , officers released cctv of a person they described as being a lone man wearing a `` distinctive top which has a large dark strip across the front '' .
the footage relates to an incident on mayflower avenue , exeter in the early hours of tuesday 15 august , when the man was seen setting fire to a hedge .
detectives are still appealing for people with any information to come forward .
author: Hamish Marshall
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: boy has cash stolen in cornwall street robbery
text: an 11-year-old boy was put in a headlock by a teen who then stole £ 20 from his bag in a street robbery in fraddon .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: paignton house fire 'started deliberately '
text: firefighters have tackled a blaze at a house in paignton which is thought to have been started deliberately .
crews were sent to the mid-terraced house in elmsleigh road when the alarm was raised just after 03:30 .
devon and somerset fire and rescue service said the blaze has totally destroyed the kitchen and the rest of the unoccupied house was `` 100 % damaged by smoke '' .
arson is suspected and the fire service and devon and cornwall police are investigating .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: cornwall travel update : spring tides affect st mawes ferry
text: there 's no service on the st mawes ferry from the prince of wales pier , falmouth , at 11:15 or from st mawes at 11:45 due to the spring tides .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: four arrested after m5 police chase
text: four people were arrested after a police chase along the m5 through devon after a store was raided in the county .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: devon travel update : sheep on the road in bishopsteignton
text: reports of sheep in the road in bishopsteignton on a381 newton road around cockhaven road .
author: BBC Radio Devon

BBC Weather

author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: plans for new royal clarence hotel considered
text: pans to rebuild the royal clarence hotel in exeter will go before the city 's planning committee later .
the hotel - thought to be one of the oldest in england - partially collapsed after a huge fire in october 2016 caused catastrophic damage to the historic buildings .
some concerns have been raised about the increased height of the new hotel but planning officers are recommending councillors approve the proposals .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: engagement joy after man ( literally ) falls for girlfriend !
text: a bristol couple are celebrating their engagement after the man did n't let a fall and a broken ankle stop him from popping the question .
john dardis had planned a romantic proposal for girlfriend suzannah newham , while they were enjoying a weekend in cornwall .

his plans were nearly scuppered when he fell and broke his ankle while the couple were walking on the coast path near newquay - but he popped the question anyway , while waiting for emergency services .
regie butler from newquay coastguard rescue officer 's quipped : `` he literally fell for her . ''

`` even though he was in some pain , he decided to go ahead with a romantic proposal overlooking the sea , rather than from a hospital bed i think the euphoria of suzannah saying yes helped overcome the pain . ''
author: Amy Gladwell
BBC News Online

documents.title: motorcyclist dies from crash injuries
text: a motorcyclist injured in a three-vehicle crash near truro on friday has died .
the 53-year-old was travelling out of tregony on his yamaha bike when it collided with a land rover , which was then in collision with an audi .
he was taken to the royal cornwall hospital , but later died as a result of his injuries .
anyone who witnessed the accident is asked to contact police .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: mental health care for new mums questioned
text: new mums suffering postnatal depression and other serious mental illnesses are having to travel hundreds of miles to access inpatient treatment with their babies , it has been revealed .
freedom of information requests show one in five women travelled more than 50 miles and one in 20 travelled more than 100 miles .
one mother from cornwall , who was sent to a mother and baby unit in bristol , said the distance made it hard for visitors and put an additional strain on family finances .
`` my mum came as often as she could , but she had to get the bus , so that was obviously a difficult journey to make and my husband managed to come most weekends , but he was working , '' she said .
the investigation coincides with the re-launch of a local service at the maternity wing at the royal cornwall hospital at treliske .
author: Shelley Phelps
BBC reporter

documents.title: empty student flats rented out as posh holiday apartments
text: empty student flats in plymouth are being rented out to tourists as posh holiday apartments - at the same time as more are being built in the city , it 's been revealed .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: woman , 28 , talks about depression
text: a 28-year-old woman has revealed how promotion at work sparked a deep depression which damaged her health and caused her to attempt suicide several times .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: travel update for cornwall : redruth roadworks
text: slow traffic on the a3047 in redruth , with roadworks and lane closures at the mount ambrose roundabout .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: travel update for devon : bideford long bridge closed to traffic
text: travel update for devon : bideford long bridge closed to traffic

documents.title: monday 's weather for devon and cornwall : mainly cloudy and dry
text: a mixture of sunny spells and cloudier intervals .
most places across devon and cornwall will remain dry , but a few light showers are possible across the west .
winds will remain light throughout today with a maximum temperature of 11c ( 52f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: ambulance service suffers computer failure
text: the south western ambulance service says its phone lines are working again and it 's trying to find out what caused a major electrical fault that caused them to fail on sunday .
the problems with the phones and computers forced the service to revert to a backup system .
on sunday , it issued a statement asking people to only call 999 in a life threatening emergency .
in a statement on monday , the service said it was working to reinstate the remaining computer services and to understand the cause of the failure .

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for monday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online
